abstract: Jerusalem Youth Chorus, initiative that brings young Israelis and Palestinians together for music and professionally-mediated dialogue sessions, is one of few successful efforts at coexistence to survive increasing violence that has plagued politically charged city; chorus was founded by American Micah Hendler, who had attended Seeds of Peace summer camps as a youth and hoped model would work in Jerusalem.
lead_paragraph: The Jerusalem Youth Chorus, established in 2012, is one of the few coexistence initiatives to weather the hatred and violence that have erupted on both sides over the past year.

headline.main: Youth Chorus Unites Israelis and Palestinians, at Least for a Few Hours
headline.print_headline: Youth Chorus Unites Israelis and Palestinians, at Least for a Few Hours

snippet: The Jerusalem Youth Chorus, established in 2012, is one of the few coexistence initiatives to weather the hatred and violence that have erupted on both sides over the past year.
